servers.description: The URL of the API *may* freely be chosen by the back-end providers. The path, including API versioning, is a *recommendation* only. Nevertheless, all servers *must* support HTTPS as the authentication with Oauth2 and HTTP is not secure!

version.description: API versioning is *recommended*. It *must* not be used by the clients to detect the version number of the API. Use the version number returned from `GET /` instead.

info.title: OpenEO API
info.description:
The OpenEO API specification for interoperable cloud-based processing of large Earth observation datasets. **This version is still incomplete and intended for working on prototypes.**

Things that are currently missing particularly include: 
 * Authentication and authorization (probably with OAuth 2.0), 
 * how data is streamed into UDFs and how the output of UDFs is returned, 
 * how billing can be handled,
 * how resources can be filtered or shared.

tags.name: Capabilities
tags.description: General information about the API implementation and other supported capabilities at a specific back-end.

tags.name: EO Data Discovery
tags.description: Discovery of Earth observation datasets that are available at the back-end.

tags.name: Process Discovery
tags.description: Discovery of processes that are available at the back-end.

tags.name: UDF Runtime Discovery
tags.description: Discovery of programming languages and their runtime environments to execute user-defined functions at the back-end.

tags.name: Job Management
tags.description: Services to manage jobs and their computations.

tags.name: Web Service Management
tags.description: Management of web-services for accessing job results.

tags.name: CORS
tags.description: Endpoints to allow Cross Origin Requests for requests from internet browsers/JavaScript.

get.summary: Returns the capabilities, i.e., which openEO API version and endpoints / feature are supported  by the back-end.
get.description:
The request will ask the back-end which version and features of the openEO API are supported and return a JSON description with available endpoints.
Variables in the paths must be placed in curly braces, e.g. `{process_id}`, and have a self-speaking name.

200.description: Information about the API version and supported endpoints / features.

get.summary: Returns output formats supported by the back-end.
get.description:
The request will ask the back-end for supported output formats, e.g. PNG, GTiff and time series, and its default output format. The response is an object of the default and all available output formats and their options. This does not include the supported web services.
**Note**: Whenever available, the output format names and options should be fully aligned with GDAL, see http://www.gdal.org/formats_list.html. Some file formats not available through GDAL might be defined centrally for openEO in the documentation. Custom output formats or options can be defined wherever needed. Not all output format options supported by GDAL need to be supported.

200.description: An object with the default output format and a map containing all output formats as keys and an object that defines available options.

additionalProperties.description: Description of the argument, should contain a default value.

GTiff.tiled: By default [false] stripped TIFF files are created. This option can be used to force creation of tiled TIFF files [true].
GTiff.jpeg_quality: Set the JPEG quality [1-100] when using JPEG compression. Default: 75

PNG.worldfile: Force the generation of an associated ESRI world file.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns basic information about EO datasets that are available at the back-end.
get.description: Requests will ask the back-end for available data and will return an array of available datasets with very basic information such as their unique identifiers. Results can be filtered by space, time, and dataset name with very simple search expressions.

parameters.name: qname
parameters.description: string expression to search available datasets by name

parameters.name: qgeom
parameters.description: WKT polygon to search for available datasets that spatially intersect with the polygon

parameters.name: qstartdate
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date/time string to find datasets with any data acquired after the given date/time

parameters.name: qenddate
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date/time string to find datasets with any data acquired before the given date/time

200.description: An array of EO datasets including their unique identifiers and some basic metadata.

value.description: MODIS/Terra Surface Reflectance 8-Day L3 Global 250m SIN Grid V006
Sentinel 2 Level-1C: Top-of-atmosphere reflectances in cartographic geometry

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns further information on a given EO dataset available at the back-end.
get.description: The request will ask the back-end for further details about a dataset specified by the identifier `data_id`

200.description: JSON object with metadata of the EO dataset.

extent.description: spatial extent of the available imagery

srs.description: spatial reference system readable by GDAL (e.g. as 'WKT', 'proj4', or 'EPSG:xy')

value.description: Sentinel 2 Level-1C: Top-of-atmosphere reflectances in cartographic geometry

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns processes supported by the back-end.
get.description: The request will ask the back-end for available processes and will return an array of available processes with their unique identifiers and description.

parameters.name: qname
parameters.description: string expression to search for available processes by name

200.description: An array of EO processes including their unique identifiers and a description.

value.description: Computes the normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) for all pixels of the input dataset.
Applies median aggregation to pixel time series for all bands of the input dataset.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns further information on a given EO process available at the back-end.
get.description: The request will ask the back-end for further details about a process specified by identifier

200.description: JSON object with metadata of the EO process.

value.description: Applies median aggregation to pixel time series for all bands of the input dataset.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Check whether the user is registered with the specified credentials at the back-end.
get.description:
***Work in progress.** The general authentication procedure is to be defined and will probably change in the future.*
This request checks whether the credentials provided in the HTTP Basic header are valid. Returns the corresponding internal user ID and a bearer token.

200.description: Login successful. Returns the user ID and a bearer token for future API calls.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

post.description:
***Work in progress.** The general authentication procedure is to be defined and will probably change in the future.*
This request registers a new user account.

200.description: Registration successful. Returns the newly created user ID.

schema.description: Password to be used for the newly created user account.

requestBody.description: Password to be used for the newly created user account.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Lists user-defined process graphs.
get.description: This service lists all process graphs of the user that are stored at the back-end.

200.description: JSON array with process graph ids

post.summary: Submits a new process graph and returns a unqiue identifier.
post.description: Creates a unique resource for a provided process graph that can be reused in other process graphs.

200.description: JSON object with process graph identifier

requestBody.description: Specifies the process graph with a title.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

204.description: Confirms that the process graph is valid

requestBody.description: Specifies the process graph to be validated.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Get a process graph by id.
get.description: Returns a JSON processs graph from its id.

200.description: JSON object with process graph

patch.summary: Replaces a process graph or modifies the title.
patch.description: Replaces a process graph or modifies the title, but maintains the identifier.

204.description: The process graph has been replaced successfully.

requestBody.description: Specifies the process graph with a title.

delete.summary: Deletes a process graph with given id.

204.description: The process graph has been successfully deleted

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

post.description: Process graphs will be executed directly and the result will be downloaded in the specified format. Requests might time-out after a certain amount of time.

200.description: Result data in the specified output format

Content-Type.description: The appropriate mime type for the requested output format must be sent.

requestBody.description: Specifies the job details, e.g. the process graph and the output format.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: List all running services that have been submitted by the user.
get.description: Requests to this endpoint will list all running services submitted by a user with given id.

200.description: Array of service descriptions

post.description: Calling this endpoint will enable to access results of a job as a web service such as WMTS, TMS or WCS. Depending on the specified job the service bases on pre-computed data (batch job) or needs to compute them on-demand (on-demand job). For on-demand jobs the evaluation should pe performed in the sense that it is only evaluated for the requested spatial / temporal extent and resolution.

200.description: Details of the created service

requestBody.description: The base data for the service to create

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns web service types supported by the back-end.
get.description: The request will ask the back-end for supported web service types, e.g. wms, tms, wmts or wcs. The response is an array of available web services types.

200.description: An array of implemented web service types

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

patch.description: Calling this endpoint will change the specified web service, but maintain its identifier. Changes can be group in a single request. Only service args and the title can be modified. To change the service type create a new service.

204.description: Changes to the service applied successfully.

requestBody.description: The data to change for the spcified service

get.summary: Get service information by id.
get.description: Requests to this endpoint will return JSON description of the service.

200.description: Details of the created service

delete.summary: Stop a given service by id
delete.description: Calling this endpoint will stop a given web service to access result data.

204.description: The service has been successfully deleted.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: List all jobs that have been submitted by the user.
get.description: Requests to this service will list all jobs submitted by a user with given id.

200.description: Array of job descriptions

post.summary: Submits a new job to the back-end.
post.description: Creates a new job from one or more (chained) processes at the back-end.

200.description: Details of the created job

requestBody.description: Specifies the job details, e.g. the process graph and _optionally_ the output format. The output format might be also specified later during download and is not necessary for web services at all.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

patch.summary: Modifies a job at the back-end.
patch.description: Modifies an existing job at the back-end but maintains the identifier. All running calculations are stopped if required and possible. Changes can be group in a single request. Job ID, Status, timestamps, user ID and consumed credits can't be modified.

204.description: Changes to the job applied successfully.

requestBody.description: Specifies the job details to update.

get.summary: Returns information about a submitted job.
get.description: Returns detailed information about a submitted job including its current status and the underlying process graph

200.description: Full job information.

delete.summary: Deletes a job with the given id.
delete.description: Deletes all data related to this job. For batch jobs this request stops all related computations at the back-end and deletes the computed results. On-demand jobs will not respond to any further requests, e.g. download calls or service requests. This job won't generate additional costs for processing. Any service associated with this job is deleted from the back-end.

204.description: The job has been successfully deleted

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Subscribes to job execution updates that are communicated over WebSockets.
get.description: ***Reserved for later use.** The WebSocket-based protocol communicating the job updates is to be defined.*

101.description: Successful subscription to job updates returns in a protocol change to a web socket connection.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

post.summary: Running a job in on-demand mode.
post.description: This request converts a job into an on-demand job. Results are computed whenever needed during a download or web-service request.

204.description: The job now responds in on-demand mode.

delete.description: Ondemand requests are disallowed after this requests and calls to on-demand endpoints and web services won't compute results. Therefore no additional costs can be charged.

204.description: Batch processing has been stopped and result have been deleted.

get.summary: Request download links for on-demand computed results of jobs.
get.description: This request will provide links to download results of on-demand jobs. Depending on the Content-Type header, the response is either a simple JSON array with URLs as strings or a metalink XML document. Requests might time-out after a certain amount of time.

200.description: Valid download links have been returned. The download links doesn't necessarily need to be located under the API base url.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

post.summary: Running a job in batch mode.
post.description: This request converts a job into a batch job and queues it for execution. A paused job can be resumed with this request.

requestBody.description: Specifies the batch processing details, i.e. the output format.

204.description: The job is queued to compute results in batch mode, i.e. results are pre-processed.

delete.summary: Stops batch processing and deletes the results.
delete.description: This request stops all related computations at the back-end and deletes the computed results. The batch computation won't generate additional costs.

204.description: Batch processing has been stopped and result have been deleted.

get.summary: Request download links for results of batch jobs.
get.description: This request will provide links to download results of batch jobs. Depending on the Content-Type header, the response is either a simple JSON array with URLs as strings or a metalink XML document.

200.description: Valid download links have been returned. The download links doesn't necessarily need to be located under the API base url.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: List user-uploaded files.
get.description: This service lists all user-uploaded files that are stored at the back-end.

200.description: Flattened file tree with path relative to the user's root directory and some basic properties such as the file size and the timestamp of the last modification. All properties except the name are optional.

modified.description: Date and time the file has been modified at last in ISO8601 format

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Download a user file.
get.description: This service downloads a user files identified by its path relative to the user's root directory.

200.description: file from user storage

put.summary: Upload a new or update an existing user file.
put.description: This service uploads a new or updates an existing file at a given path.

204.description: The file upload has been successful.

delete.description: This service deletes an existing user-uploaded file specified by its path.

204.description: The file has been successfully deleted at the back-end.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns available user credits.
get.description:
***Reserved for later use.** The credit system and payment procedures are to be defined.*
For back-ends that involve accounting, this service will return the currently available credits. Other back-ends may simply return `Infinity`

200.description: Available credits

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns the programming languages including their environments and UDF types supported.
get.description: Describes how custom user-defined functions can be exposed to the data and which programming languages and environments are supported by the back-end.

200.description: Description of UDF runtime support

items.description: A map with language identifiers such as `R` as keys and an object that defines available versions, extension packages, and UDF schemas.

versions.description: A map with version identifiers as keys and an object value that specifies which extension packages are available for the particular version.

additionalProperties.description: Extension package identifiers that should include their version number such as `'sf__0.5-4'`

parameters.name: udf_type
parameters.description: The UDF types define how UDFs can be exposed to the data, how they can be parallelized, and how the result schema should be structured.

options.summary: Response to allow Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.
options.description: Response for the preflight requests made by some clients due to Cross-Origin Resource Sharing restrictions. It sends the appropriate headers for this endpoint as defined in the section "Responses". See https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/ for more information.

get.summary: Returns the process description of UDF schemas.
get.description: Returns the process description of UDF schemas, which offer different possibilities how user-defined scripts can be applied to the data.

200.description: Process description

value.description: Applies the given R script on all time series of the input imagery. The R script gets pixel values (all bands) of complete time series as input and must result in a single value or tuple for multiple bands.

script.description: R script that will be applied over time series

process_description.description: Defines and describes a process including it's expected input arguments.

process_id.description: The unique identifier of the process.

description.description: A short and concise description of what the process does and how the output looks like.

link.description: Reference to an external process definition if the process has been defined over different back ends within OpenEO

description.description: A short and concise description of the process argument.

required.description: Defines whether an argument is required or optional.

additionalProperties.description: **DEFAULT VALUES FOR ARGUMENTS ARE NOT FORMALIZED IN THE SWAGGER 2.0 DEFINITION DUE TO MISSING SUPPORT FOR oneOf OR anyOf SCHEMA COMBINATIONS.**

example.description: Perform basic arithmetic expressions on individual pixel and their band values.

expr.description: expressions as array, the result will have as many bands as the number of given expressions.

band_datatype.description: Data type for band values including its bit size.

name.description: optional name to refer to bands by name such as 'red' instead of their band_id.

offset.description: offset to convert band values to the actual measurement scale.

scale.description: scale to convert band values to the actual measurement scale.

udf_type.description: The UDF types define how UDFs can be exposed to the data, how they can be parallelized, and how the result schema should be structured.

udf_description.description: Defines and describes a UDF using the same schema as the description of processes offered by the back-end.

process_id.description: The unique identifier of the process.

description.description: A short and concise description of what the process does and how the output looks like.

link.description: Reference to an external process definition if the process has been defined over different back ends within OpenEO

description.description: A short and concise description of the process argument.

required.description: Defines whether an argument is required or optional.

additionalProperties.description: **DEFAULT VALUES FOR ARGUMENTS ARE NOT FORMALIZED IN THE SWAGGER 2.0 DEFINITION DUE TO MISSING SUPPORT FOR oneOf OR anyOf SCHEMA COMBINATIONS.**

example.description: Applies an R function independently over all input time series that produces a zero-dimensional value (scalar or multi-band tuple) as output (per time series).

script.description: Script resource that has been uploaded to user space before.

process_graph.description: A process graph defines an executable process, i.e. one process or a combination of chained processes including specific arguments.

process_id.description: The unique identifier of the process.

description.description: An optional description for the process or the chained processes.

example.description: Deriving minimum NDVI measurements over pixel time series of Sentinel 2 imagery.

arg_set.description: Defines an object schema for a collection of uniquely named arguments (argument set) as input to processes. The values can by any of the JSON data types string, number, array, boolean or null. Additionally it can be any object of type **process_graph**. An array must always contain one data type only and is allowed to contain the data types allowed for argument set values. In consequence, the objects allowed to be part of an array are process_graphs only. See the API Concept Description for more information.

job_id.description: Unique identifier of a job that is generated by the back-end during job submission.

job_submitted.description: Date and time of job submission in ISO 8601 format

job_updated.description: Date and time of last status change in ISO 8601 format

job_user_id.description: Identifier of the user, who submitted the job and pays incurred costs if needed.

job_mode.description: The execution mode of the job.

job_status.description:
The current status of the job. Allowed values for each job mode:
  * none: submitted (default), error
  * on_demand: running (default), error
  * batch: queued, running, finished, error

job_full.description: Defines full metadata of processing jobs that have been submitted by users.

job_meta.description: Defines a metadata subset of processing jobs that have been submitted by users. To get the full metadata for a job, including view and process graph, call `GET /jobs/{job_id}`

title.description: A short description to easily distinguish datasets.

service_type.description: Definintion of possible web services to access result data. All available web service types can be retrieved via `GET /service_types`

service_args.description: Definintion of additional arguments a web service might need to be created. For example, this could specify the required version of the service, visualization details or any other service dependant configuration.

service.description: Defines metadata of running services to access result data.

service_id.description: Unique identifier of a service that is generated by the back-end during service creation.

url.description: URL at which the service is accessible. Doesn't necessarily need to contain the API base url.

job_id.description: The job identifier string refering to the job this service is running for.

output_format_body.description: Output format to be used. Supported formats and options can be retrieved using the endpoint `GET /output_formats`.

format.description: One of the supported output formats.

error.description: An error object declares addtional information about a client-side or server-side error.

externalDocs.description: Additional information regarding error handling and a list of error codes.

id.description: A back-end may add a unique identifier to the error response to be able to log and track errors with further non-disclosable details.

code.description: The code is either one of the standardized error codes or a custom error code with a number greater than 10000.

message.description: The message explains what the client might need to change or what the server is struggling with. By default the message must be sent in English language. Content Negotiation is used to localize the error messages: If an Acceppt-Language header is sent by the client and a translation is available, the message should be translated accordingly and the Content-Language header must be present in the response.

url.description: Can bet set to hold a URL to a resource that is explaining the error and potential solutions in-depth.

client_error.description: The request can't be fulfilled due to an error on client-side, i.e. the request is invalid. The client should not repeat the request without modifications. The response body *should* contain a JSON error object. *Must* be any HTTP status code specified in [RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6). This request usually does not respond with HTTP status codes 401 and 403 due to missing authorization. HTTP status code 404 should be used if the value of a path parameter is invalid.

client_error_auth.description: The request can't be fulfilled due to an error on client-side, i.e. the request is invalid. The client should not repeat the request without modifications. The response body *should* contain a JSON error object. *Must* be any HTTP status code specified in [RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6). This request *must* respond with HTTP status codes 401 if authorization is required or 403 if the authorization failed or access is forbidden in general to the authenticated user. HTTP status code 404 should be used if the value of a path parameter is invalid.

method_not_allowed.description: Method Not Allowed. The requested HTTP method is not supported or allowed to be requested.

server_error.description: The request can't be fulfilled due to an error at the back-end. The error is never the client’s fault and therefore it is reasonable for the client to retry the exact same request that triggered this response. The response body *should* contain a JSON error object. *Must* be any HTTP status code specified in [RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6).

cors_options.description: Gives internet browsers the permission to access the requested resource.

Content-Type.description: Should return the content type delivered by the request that the permission is requested for.

allow_origin.description: Allowed origin for the request. Must return the value of the request's origin header if `Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` ist set to `true`.

allow_credentials.description: If authorization is implemented by the back-end the value needs to be `true`.

allow_methods.description: Comma-separated list of HTTP methods allowed to be requested. List all implemented HTTP methods for the endpoint here.

allow_headers.description: Comma-separated list of HTTP headers allowed to be send. If the back-end requires authorization it needs to contain at least `Authorization`

file_path.name: path
file_path.description: Path relative to the user's root directory, must be URL encoded

process_graph.description: Description of one or more (chained) processes including their input arguments
